intro: Cuphea paranensis, commonly known as the Brazilian flame flower, is a flowering plant native to Brazil. It belongs to the family Lythraceae and is characterized by its striking, tubular red or orange flowers. The plant features hairy, lance-shaped leaves and produces showy, clustered inflorescences. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and as a container plant. Cuphea paranensis thrives in full sun to partial shade and well-drained soil.
